intro: Hirpicium bechuanense, commonly known as the Bechuanaland hirpicium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
